page.title: 13Local History
page.content: The loss of some notable buildings {i.e.The Royal National Hospital for {Diseases of the Chest and Steephill {Castle,}altered the area and so also did the closure in 1957 of the{railway {line}which used to run along the 'Undercliff'.This was considered to be a great loss to the district as it was one of the most delightful train journeys on the Island. {Smuggling and Smuggler's rings}have long been associated with the area and the{Smuggler's Museum}in the grounds of the Botanical Gardens has underground vaults illustrating 700 years of smuggling. There are plans to open a{Heritage {Centre}in Ventnor next year depicting various aspects of fishing and the History of the Blake Family and the 'Undercliff'.
